job.title: Machine Learning Engineer
job.industry: Hospital & Health Care,Information Technology and Services
job.description: <p><strong>Position:</strong>&nbsp;Machine Learning Engineer</p><p><strong>Location:</strong>&nbsp;100% Remote</p><p><strong>Duration:</strong>&nbsp;6-month Contract-to-Hire</p><p><strong>Start:</strong>&nbsp;ASAP</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Job Description/Objective:</strong></p><p>This will be a 6-month contract with full-time employee conversion. This is a 100% remote role, where you will be working on an exciting, cutting-edge team.&nbsp;This position develops efficient and scalable data science systems that enable integration of machine learning (ML) applications into healthcare operations, strategy, value improvement, care advancement, patient safety and satisfaction.&nbsp;This position will partner with data scientists, application developers, data architects, and system engineers to recommend and develop ML systems and pipelines.&nbsp;This position will be responsible for learning, recommending, and implementing cutting edge machine learning methodologies and tools in creative and novel ways.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>This person would be the tone setter and first one in the Machine Learning Engineer role, with their plan to build out a team behind you.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Fun Fact about our relationship with this client: </strong>We have placed half of their data architect team over the last 18 months with GREAT feedback on culture and the leadership.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Qualifications</strong></p><ul><li>CI / CD Experience</li><li>Data Engineering experience (full project life cycle, deployment to production)</li><li>Some sort of data science exposure</li><li>Experience doing end-to-end implementation of an ML pipeline for ML model deployment.</li><li>SQL &amp; Python experience</li></ul>
